Column Comment.0: OBLIGATION: a condition of commitment on the agreement which must be fulfilled.There are many types of obligations and the fulfillment of an obligation may require achange to the agreement. e.g. offset obligation, work commitment, section 96 etc.Obligations may be financial (rental payments) or non financial (drilling, reportingetc.)
Column Comment.1: OBLIGATION SEQ NO: Unique identifier for each part or occurrence of an obligation
Column Comment.2: PROVIDED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the unique ID for the business associatewho provided the service.
Column Comment.3: OBLIGATION SERVICE SEQUENCE NUMBER: key component added to allow aBusiness associate to provide multiple services to fulfill an obligation.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: CONTACT BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the identifier for the business associate who isthe contact for this service.
Column Comment.6: CONTRACT IDENTIFER: Unique identifier for a contract.
Column Comment.7: DESCRIPTION: General description of the service.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.9: SERVICE END DATE: the date that the service provided was completed.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: PROVIDED FOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: the identifier for the business associatefor whom the service was provided.
Column Comment.13: PROVISION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the provision in a contract.
Column Comment.14: RATE AND FEE SCHEDULE: A schedule for payments as set up by a businessassociate such as a service provider, jurisdiction or regulatory agency. Feeschedules are often used to administer the rates for rentals or for services provided. .
Column Comment.15: REMARK: General remarks about the service provided.
Column Comment.16: SERVICE QUALITY: A code indicating the quality of service received from thisBUSINESS ASSOCIATE, either at a specified address, or for a specific service.
Column Comment.17: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE SERVICE TYPE: A valid list of services for a businessassociate. For example well logger, drilling contractor, application developer. Forland, may be may be address for service, brokerage, maintainor etc.
Column Comment.18: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.19: SERVICE START DATE: the date that the service provided was started.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
